column1: A1;Oh
column2: that was a distant memory. I graduated from Duke University many years ago.
column6: ;I just got my MBA from Harvard last year

column1: A2;I was lucky to graduate in four years
column2: there was this one professor Dr. Rob whose classes were brutal.
column6: ;It was incredibly challenging ballancing a rigorus course workload with a full time job.

column1: A3;The hardest class by far was the micro-economics course I was so happy when I got through it with a B. I almost felt like the professor had it out for me.
column6: ;I decided I wanted to go back to school and further my education as I saw it as one of the best ways to better myself and boost my career

column1: A4;Since graduating I have started to think about going back for my MBA but I am not sure if it is the best bet for me yet. I think it might be tough being a non-traditional student and going back to school with a family.
column6: ;I really struggled with my Accounting courses as some of the math was a little overwhelming

column1: A5;And I want to continue my education but the balancing of being a non-traditional with school is just tough. I would have to take a business analytics course and I was never really good at math when I took micro-economics.
column6: ;It was a very difficult challenge but looking back on it is really rewarding

column1: B1;I met my partner Juan in Duke at a coffee shop around the corner from where we went to school.
column6: ;I'm happy I moved back out here where I am close to my family again.

column1: B2;I can speak all day about Juan and our daugher. My daughter is going to school for the first time next week. Honestly
column2: I am a little nervous about it.
column6: ;My parents have a house in the next town over
column7: so I go out and visit them fairly often

column1: B3;We will have been maried for 3 years now in December and it was one of the toughest challenges trying to get Tonie our daugher. You wouldn't believe what we had to go through.
column6: ;Its also nice as my boyfriend's family is not too far away either so we visit them but less regularly

column1: B4;The paperwork for a couple like us and the stigma just for us to adopt was tough. Many assumptions of course were made about our abilities to raise a child. It was even tough with our family
column2: some of which who didn't want to see us. I hope my whole family can accept us for who we are. You know?
column8: and I have been dating for 2 years next month
column9: we met while studying at Harvard.

column1: B5;A family trip might help the family. It also might help the family learn to accept us and get to know Tonie a bit more. I guess you could say that growing up was rough
column2: but one day I know my parents will come around. My parents were very structured in their ways and how they raised me and my sister Cassie. She has a husband and two kids of her own in California
column3: so a trip to Disney Land would be perfect.
column6: ;We moved in together about 6 months ago and its been going great
column8: so a trip to Disney Land would be perfect.

column1: C1;I work as a middle manager at the Firm and it is my 8th year in the company.
column6: ;I just got hired 2 years ago to be the Vice President of Finance.

column1: C2;My typical day involves coordinating with other employees to see what they need to get their jobs done
column2: talking with the higher ups to give estimates on schedule and put in requests and all around just working to keep things running smoothly.
column6: ;My daily work is pretty much sending emails and reviewing files

column1: C3;I got promoted three years ago after working as an analayst for a few years. However
column2: ever since they hired Sarah it seems like the CEO has been looking to her to drive all our company decisions. So who knows how much longer I will be around. But you know how it is.;It is a very challenging job but it is really rewarding when I see everything come together

column1: C4;Of course
column2: I need to report the department's progress once a week to my supervisor and that is now Sarah. I feel like she doesn't really see my potential and what I can bring to the table. Last week I spent five hours analyzing some of the data for a report. She didn't even say thank you when I handed her the report.
column7: who has a strong work ethic

column1: C5;Sometimes I'm so busy that I'm thinking I really need an assistant hahah. But then
column2: now that I am feeling stifled
column3: I am starting to think that I might just leave the firm and go somwhere where I feel valued.
column6: ;I am hoping to soon get premoted again as I want to keep growing my career

column1: D1;I came to the company 8 years ago and I don't remember ever having issues or problems fitting in with the company.
column6: ;When I first got here it was a slightly slow start trying to learn the enviroment but everyone was super supportive

column1: D2;Obviously it was very different between now and then
column2: we were a very small group at that point and now the company has grown a lot in size.
column6: ;The company has been growing a Iot in the past few years so there is always something changing

column1: D3;One of the things we try to do is monthly team lunches so we can all get a chance to connect outside of a work enviroment. I stopped going to the lunches though
column2: mainly because of how I was being treated by my supervisor. Really it was just a lack of appreciation for what effort I was putting in.;Despite the rapid growth we are trying hard to stay connected as an organization so we try to do non work related events at least once a month

column1: D4;My supervisor at one point told me they really had no care for what I was putting forward. I have asked about gaps and where I can improve
column2: but I have yet to see any type of 360 degree evaluaiton of my work. You would think around here that they would start assessing the company enviroment a bit more and looking at evaluation of our management
column6: ;My only complaint about the company as there is a disconnect with some of the higher managment levels
column7: I am trying to cover most of the gaps but some things keep slipping through

column1: D5;As a middle manager
column2: I will do anything to make sure my team members fit in the company smoothly
column3: so let me know where you need help. I will try to train you for as long as I am around
column5: I can't promise anything. It is a dog eat dog world out there. Well
column6: you will see.;In general this company has been a great place to work
column7: and as a VP I am trying too keep pushing it farther forward
column8: if there is anything you need or that I can do to help please let me or John know.
